revised_title: Roman Coins Found at Clifton Near Edlington in Yorkshire
tldr: Ralph Thoresby, F.R.S., shares his discovery of Roman coins found at Clifton near Edlington in Yorkshire. The coins were found in a dryer soil, preserving them better than others found in South Holland, Lincolnshire. Thoresby speculates that the coins were hidden during a common calamity following the death of Emperor Quintillus and were unearthed after conflicts involving Vandals and Burgundians in Britain.
